channel.title: Open Academic Environment Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: Uncovering impactful connections between technology and education in building an academic network of collaboration, discussion and feedback
channel.itunes:author: Apereo OAE
channel.itunes:summary: Higher Ed interview series and discussion panel with authority figures from educational technology, academic research, university management, policy makers to educators and instructors
channel.description: The OAE Podcast is an interview series and discussion panel where we talk to authority figures withinb higher education about technology, academic research, university management, policy makers to educators and instructors

item.title: Innovation within Institutional IT Services
item.itunes:author: Apereo OAE
item.itunes:subtitle: Nicolaas Matthijs talks to us about building innovation within the institutional contexts
item.itunes:summary: We celebrating our inaugural first episode with a very interesting interview. Today we speak with Nicolaas Matthijs currently the Project Lead for the Apereo Foundation’s Open Academic Environment Project and Lead Developer at the University of California Berkeley. He has a lot of insightful experiences and perspectives on technology in higher education and previously Lead Developer at the University of Cambridge. He is someone who continually pushes the barriers when it comes to technology for higher education, but specifically for research collaboration and learning management systems. Nicolaas shares his perspectives on the challenges, innovations and where he sees technology best serving the eco-system of learning, research and collaboration for Universities in the modern world. Follow Nicolaas at #nicolaasm If you'd like to join the conversation and add to what we've been talking about, please follow up at oaeproject.org. Or you can reach out to us on Twitter: #OAEProject. Lastly, if you'd like to hear an interview from a particular person you have in mind – from communities in edtech, research collaboration, institutional leadership or teaching and learning. Please drop us a line at: oaeproject.org/contact
